text: Does `my_arr .= foo` depend on `foo` having `length` defined for it? Is that part of the reason why numbers are iterable in Julia?

elements.text: defined for it? Is that part of the reason why numbers are iterable in Julia?

text:
No, not necessarily. It's just the regular broadcast mechanism:
```julia> Meta.@lower my_arr .= foo
:($(Expr(:thunk, CodeInfo(
    @ none within `top-level scope'
1 ─ %1 = Base.broadcasted(Base.identity, foo)
│   %2 = Base.materialize!(my_arr, %1)
└──      return %2
))))```
